nodes.bodyText: What is the meaning of setting to 'null' and empty? What is the difference between  'null' and empty?
Both empty the list. Null will remove the key. Empty list will set an empty list to the key. Both are fine for our logic.
How about add an comment to let user know the intention. This would save further clarification etc,
I was wrong, it actually just put a null value there. This is not what I want to do. Let me change it to the right behavior. Good catch!
If the value string is not valid integer representation, will this throw other Exception? If so, do you want to catch it and convert to IllegalArgumentException?
The value is not a string, it is Integer.

I am a little bit confused.
anyMatch(className -> className == null)) means if there is a className (key) in resolverMap, we throw exception.
Then how about value in resolverMap, can it be null? What does it mean then?

It is searching through the value set (the class name is value here). The stream() is not done to the key set. I think you missed the first part.
But it is a good catch that I should not remove "className.isEmpty()" check.
Right, we are saying value can't be empty or 'null'. However, don't forget about key, the key in resovlerMap is potentially can be null too, right? Shall we also throw an exception there?
resolverMap can also contain key as null. Do we want to throw exception of this case?
I see what you mean now. Make sense. Let me add the check for keys too.

nit.
StateModel definition name can't be null, resolver class name cannot be empty can't be null or empty.
We have a test case for this?
Yes, the test has been added. Let me modify the log string.
